pros:
For those who are keen to upgrade themselves:
- There are opportunities to learn various end-user tools and applications through short workshops conducted by the IT unit's Digital Enablement team and to participate in Hackathons to showcase their ability to make use of different tools in a project related to work. 
- Staff may sign up for free online courses with edX, Coursera, LinkedIn Learning, Gartner with corporate email.
- Staff with minimum service period are allocated small amount of Skills Transformation Fund which can be used to pay for NUS-CET courses, online courses at edX, Coursera or LinkedIn Learning, or courses offered by external providers.
- Consistently high-performing staff may apply for Talent Development Sponsorship which can be used to pay for Stackable Professional Certificates, parttime Bachelor or Masters programmes, or professional qualifications offered by other Institutes of Higher Learning or accreditation bodies.
cons: Skills Transformation Fund and Talent Development Sponsorship are on claims basis, which means the staff has to pay for the fees first.
